intro: Acmadenia cassiopoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a small shrub that typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. It is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
